definitions.definition: To go and use the potty: to leave in order to urinate or defecate.
definitions.example: I have to go potty!

definitions.definition: To go crazy: to become insane.
(diminutive) A chamber pot, particularly (children) the pot used when toilet-training children.
(diminutive) Any other device or place for urination or defecation: a toilet; a lavatory; a latrine; an outhouse.
Insane.
definitions.example: The noise that the neighbour's kids were making was driving Fred potty.

definitions.definition: Easy to pot the ball on.
The master of a ship.
A coach, director, or other leader.
The captain of a sports team such as football, cricket, rugby or curling.
To captain a ship or a sports team.
Agent noun of skip: one who skips.
A person who skips, or fails to attend class.
Any of various butterflies of the families Hesperiidae and its subfamily Megathyminae, having a hairy mothlike body, hooked tips on the antennae, and a darting flight pattern.
Any of several marine fishes that often leap above water, especially Cololabis saira, the Pacific saury.
A young, thoughtless person.
The cheese maggot, the larva of a cheese fly, in Piophilidae, which leaps to escape predators.
A barn or shed in which to shelter for the night.
To take shelter in a barn or shed.
A male goose.
A fool, simpleton.
(used only with “have”, “get” and “take”) A glance, look.
definitions.example: Have a gander at what he’s written.

definitions.definition: A man living apart from his wife.
Ramble, wander
A variation of soccer played on a smaller pitch, and with only five players in a team.
Something preliminary, such as a trial, report, race, etc.
Preliminary
A shrine dedicated to some prophetic deity.
A person such as a priest through whom the deity is supposed to respond with prophecy or advice.
A prophetic response, often enigmatic or allegorical, so given.
A person considered to be a source of wisdom.
definitions.example: a literary oracle

definitions.definition: A wise sentence or decision of great authority.
One who communicates a divine command; an angel; a prophet.
A theoretical entity capable of answering some collection of questions.
(Jewish antiquity) The sanctuary, or most holy place in the temple; also, the temple itself.
To utter oracles or prophecies.
The conviction that it is morally wrong to settle disputes (especially between countries) by war or other violent means.
The additional challenge of winning a game without attacking any enemy characters.
A dry-cured ham from Italy, thinly sliced.
A fraction in the form of one integer divided by another, non-zero, integer.
An advocacy group.
Any style in art, architecture, literature, philosophy, etc., that reacts against an earlier modernist movement.
An attitude of skepticism or irony toward modernist ideologies, often questioning the assumptions of Enlightenment rationality and rejecting the idea of objective truth.
A pond or reservoir produced by damming a river or stream in order to provide a steady source of water for a millrace.
An electromagnetic wave with wavelength between that of infrared light and radio waves.
To cook (something) in a microwave oven.
An oven that uses microwave energy to heat food or other items placed within it.
A tank designed to hold petrol
A person sitting (typically) in the back seat of a car issuing (unsolicited and usually unwanted) instructions to the driver.
An opinionated person who offers (unsolicited and often unwanted) advice on the best way to handle a situation.
A bar in a web browser that displays the address (uniform resource identifier) of the page or resource being displayed.
An act of religious worship.
Admiration or esteem.
The act of adoring; loving devotion or fascination.
The selection of a pope by acclamation and before any formal ballot (excluded as a voting method in 1621 by Pope Gregory XV).
To place inside a box; to pack in one or more boxes.
Usually followed by in: to surround and enclose in a way that restricts movement; to corner, to hem in.
To mix two containers of paint of similar colour to ensure that the color is identical.
To make an incision or hole in (a tree) for the purpose of procuring the sap.
To enclose with boarding, lathing, etc., so as to conceal (for example, pipes) or to bring to a required form.
To furnish (for example, the axle of a wheel) with a box.
To enclose (images, text, etc.) in a box.
To place a value of a primitive type into a corresponding object.
To strike with the fists; to punch.
definitions.example: Leave this place before I box you!

definitions.definition: To fight against (a person) in a boxing match.
To participate in boxing; to be a boxer.
A sport where two opponents punch each other with gloved fists, the object being to score more points by the end of the match or by knockout, or technical knockout.
To place inside a box; to pack in one or more boxes.
Usually followed by in: to surround and enclose in a way that restricts movement; to corner, to hem in.
To mix two containers of paint of similar colour to ensure that the color is identical.
To make an incision or hole in (a tree) for the purpose of procuring the sap.
To enclose with boarding, lathing, etc., so as to conceal (for example, pipes) or to bring to a required form.
To furnish (for example, the axle of a wheel) with a box.
To enclose (images, text, etc.) in a box.
To place a value of a primitive type into a corresponding object.
To strike with the fists; to punch.
definitions.example: Leave this place before I box you!

definitions.definition: To fight against (a person) in a boxing match.
To participate in boxing; to be a boxer.
Material used for making boxes or casing.
Casing.
Automatic conversion of value types to objects by wrapping them within a heap-allocated reference type.
All vehicles that move on a railway, powered or unpowered.
Any such vehicle.

Rental housing owned and managed by the government, non-profit organizations, or by a combination of the two, with the aim of providing affordable housing, often focusing on disadvantaged groups such as low-income earners, social-security recipients, the elderly and people with disabilities.
A wall separating two cavities; a partition
A partition that separates the cells of a fruit.
A partition that separates the cells of a (septated) fungus.
One of the radial calcareous plates of a coral.
One of the transverse partitions dividing the shell of a mollusk, or of a rhizopod, into several chambers.
One of the transverse partitions dividing the body cavity of an annelid.
A nose piercing that goes through the nasal septum.
To add a name to the list of people who are participating in something.
definitions.example: We signed up Bob for kitchen cleanup duty.

definitions.definition: To add one's own name to the list of people who are participating in something (including amateur, but not professional, teams)
definitions.example: Terry signed up for the soccer team.

definitions.definition: To agree to purchase some good or service.
definitions.example: After much deliberation we decided to sign up for satellite TV.

definitions.definition: One who saps; specifically, one who is employed in working at saps, building and repairing fortifications, and the like. Often known as a combat engineer or military engineer.
An officer or private of the Royal Engineers.
To join (two things) together, or (one thing) to (another).
definitions.example: I've coupled our system to theirs.

definitions.definition: To join in wedlock; to marry.
To join in sexual intercourse; to copulate.
Act of joining together to form a couple
A device that couples two things together
The degree of reliance between two program modules
A connection between two electronic circuits such that a signal can pass between them
The property of physical systems that they are interacting with each other
(sexuality) sexual intercourse
A draught administered to an animal.
A drink; a draught; specifically, a potion of medicine poured or forced down the throat; also, a potion that causes purging.
To soak, to make very wet.
To cause to drink; especially, to dose (e.g. a horse) with medicine by force.
A military vassal, mentioned in the Domesday Book.
An emperor of Russia (1547 to 1917) and of some South Slavic states.
A person with great power; an autocrat.
A device that provides bank customers with cash withdrawal and other services without the need for a human teller.
A person who tells stories.
A bank clerk who receives and pays out money.
A person who counts the votes in an election.
A pharmaceutical or pharmacological preparation or product; a drug.
Of, or relating to pharmacy or pharmacists.
A yellowish-brown colour.
A darkening of the skin resulting from exposure to sunlight or similar light sources.
definitions.example: She still has a tan from her vacation in Mexico.

definitions.definition: The bark of an oak or other tree from which tannic acid is obtained.
Of a yellowish-brown.
definitions.example: Mine is the white car parked next to the tan pickup truck.

definitions.definition: Having dark skin as a result of exposure to the sun.
definitions.example: You’re looking very tan this week.

definitions.definition: To change to a tan colour due to exposure to the sun.
definitions.example: No matter how long I stay out in the sun, I never tan. though I do burn.

definitions.definition: To change an animal hide into leather by soaking it in tannic acid. To work as a tanner.
To spank or beat.
The second cardinal number two, formerly used in Celtic areas, especially Cumbria and parts of Yorkshire, for counting sheep, and stitches in knitting.
An Armenian drink made of yoghurt and water similar to airan and doogh
A traditional South and East Asian unit of weight, based upon the load of a shoulder pole and varying by place and over time but usually standardized at about 60 kg.
A twig or small switch.
A young male chicken.
An estimate that is hardly any better than a guess, often because it is based on insufficient or unreliable data.
To make a guesstimate.
To make a guesstimate of a specific quantity.
The electronic panel that is used to direct telephone calls to the desired recipient.
A device that directs electricity from one source to another.
A vehicle used by firefighters to pump water to fight a fire. Typically, a fire engine carries a supply of water and has the ability to connect to an external water supply.
Any fire apparatus, such as the pumping apparatus on a fire boat.
The descent of a person, family, or group from an ancestor or ancestors; lineage or pedigree.
A record or table of such descent; a family tree.
The study, and formal recording of such descents.
A veil which covers the face, worn by some Muslim women as a part of sartorial hijab.
An utterance or sound of the voice like "hem", often indicative of hesitation or doubt, sometimes used to call attention.
To make the sound expressed by the word hem; to hesitate in speaking.
Used to fill in the gap of a pause with a vocalized sound.
The border of an article of clothing doubled back and stitched together to finish the edge and prevent it from fraying.
A rim or margin of something.
In sheet metal design, a rim or edge folded back on itself to create a smooth edge and to increase strength or rigidity.
(in sewing) To make a hem.
: To put hem on an article of clothing, to edge or put a border on something.
: To surround something or someone in a confining way.
definitions.example: A small yard hemmed about by a tall hedge.

definitions.definition: Them (now only in unstressed position following a consonant).
The pastime of walking in hilly countryside.
A metallic or stony object or body that is the remains of a meteoroid.
To divide (a thing) into separate parts.
definitions.example: Separate the articles from the headings.

definitions.definition: To disunite from a group or mass; to disconnect.
To cause (things or people) to be separate.
definitions.example: If the kids get too noisy, separate them for a few minutes.

definitions.definition: To divide itself into separate pieces or substances.
definitions.example: The sauce will separate if you don't keep stirring.

definitions.definition: To set apart; to select from among others, as for a special use or service.
Detached; not connected or joined; two or more things stand apart.
(of spouses) Estranged; living apart but not divorced.
A style of combat sport allowing a wide range of combat techniques such as striking and grappling.

Any of various parasitic bloodsucking roundworms which cause disease, especially the species Ancylostoma duodenale and Necator americanus, having hooked mouthparts and entering their hosts by boring through the skin.
A warm cloth cap worn while sleeping, often with pajamas, being common attire in northern Europe before effective home heating became widespread.
definitions.example: Winston wore a nightcap to stave off the cold.

definitions.definition: A beverage drunk before bed that is usually alcoholic.
definitions.example: I'll make myself a nightcap of whisky and lemon before heading to bed.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Something the person reads or listens to before bed.
The final match of a sporting contest, especially the second game of a baseball doubleheader.
A cap drawn over the face of the condemned person before they are hanged.
An edible fish, Thyrsites atun, native to South African (Cape), South American and Australian waters, often smoked or salted.
(Natal) The queen mackerel, Scomberomorus lineolatus.
(Transkei) Any of several species of barracuda.
A large sea turtle, Dermochelys coriacea, with a leathery back.
A screen with a wider aspect ratio than the ordinary 35-millimeter frame, making more effective use of the human field of view and producing a more immersive view experience.
Filmed in a greater aspect ratio than the 1.33:1 or 1.37:1 aspect ratio.
(of a motion picture) Presented in the original aspect ratio; presented in letterbox orientation.
A search for people believed to be using sorcery or harmful magic, especially in order to punish them.
An attempt to find and publicly punish a group of people perceived as a threat, usually on ideological or political grounds.
A public smear-campaign against an individual.
An especially large or powerful person, animal, or thing.
A platform-mounted machine for drilling rock.
Especially large or powerful.
Short for mumbo jumbo.
A minor annoyance or inconvenience.
A person or thing causing annoyance or inconvenience.
Anything harmful or offensive to the community or to a member of it, for which a legal remedy exists.
definitions.example: a public nuisance

definitions.definition: An early manuscript book.
A book bound in the modern manner, by joining pages, as opposed to a rolled scroll.
An official list of medicines and medicinal ingredients.
To shield from light.
definitions.example: The old oak tree shaded the lawn in the heat of the day.

definitions.definition: To alter slightly.
definitions.example: Most politicians will shade the truth if it helps them.

definitions.definition: To vary or approach something slightly, particularly in color.
definitions.example: The hillside was bright green, shading towards gold in the drier areas.

definitions.definition: (of a defensive player) To move slightly from one's normal fielding position.
definitions.example: Jones will shade a little to the right on this pitch count.

definitions.definition: To darken, particularly in drawing.
definitions.example: I draw contours first, gradually shading in midtones and shadows.

definitions.definition: To surpass by a narrow margin.
definitions.example: Both parties claimed afterwards that their man did best in the debate, but an early opinion poll suggested Mr Cameron shaded it.

definitions.definition: To reduce (a window) so that only its title bar is visible.
To shelter; to cover from injury; to protect; to screen.
To present a shadow or image of; to shadow forth; to represent.
(plants) A plant of various species, chiefly cruciferous. The leaves have a moderately pungent taste, and are used as a salad and antiscorbutic.
The angular distance north or south from a planet's equator, measured along the meridian of that particular point.
An imaginary line (in fact a circumference) around a planet running parallel to the planet's equator.
The relative freedom from restrictions; scope to do something.
definitions.example: His parents gave him a great deal of latitude.

definitions.definition: The angular distance of a heavenly body from the ecliptic.
The extent to which a light-sensitive material can be over- or underexposed and still achieve an acceptable result.
Extent or scope; e.g. breadth, width or amplitude.
A person, especially one formerly popular or influential, who continues in their field after their popularity or effectiveness has peaked and is now in decline.
Not capable of being denied, challenged, or disputed; closed to questioning.
definitions.example: Her statement that Hitler was evil is incontrovertible.

definitions.definition: Having personal motivation toward the betterment of the public.
Suricata suricatta, a small carnivorous mammal of the mongoose family, from the Kalahari Desert, known for its habit of standing on its hind legs.
Agent noun of coast: one who coasts.
Something that coasts, such as a sled or toboggan.
A merchant vessel that stays in coastal waters.
A sailor who travels only in coastal waters.
A person who originates from or inhabits a coastal area.
A small piece of material used to protect the surface of a table, upon which one places cups or mugs.
A small tray on wheels, used to pass something around a table.
A worthless compact disc or DVD, such as one that was burned incorrectly.
A rollercoaster.
(Lake Superior) A coaster trout (brook trout, Salvelinus fontinalis)
A prostitute, especially a white woman, plying her trade in Chinese port towns.
To reduce the book value of (an asset) to zero.
To record (an expenditure) as an expense.
To remove a portion of a debt or an amount of an account owed, counting it as a loss (as a gesture of goodwill for example).
To record a notional expense such as amortization or depreciation.
To treat as a write-off, a total loss, especially something damaged beyond economic repair.
To assign a low value to (something).
definitions.example: When Katya was injured, he wrote off the team's chances in the finals.

definitions.definition: The act of persuading, or trying to do so; the addressing of arguments to someone with the intention of changing their mind or convincing them of a certain point of view, course of action etc.
An argument or other statement intended to influence one's opinions or beliefs; a way of persuading someone.
A strongly held conviction, opinion or belief.
definitions.example: It is his persuasion that abortion should never be condoned.

definitions.definition: One's ability or power to influence someone's opinions or feelings; persuasiveness.
A specified religious adherence, a creed; any school of thought or ideology.
(by extension, often humorous) Another personal, animal or inanimate trait that is not (very) liable to be changed by persuasion, such as sex, gender, ethnicity, origin, profession or nature.
The sound made by a duck.
definitions.example: Did you hear that duck make a quack?

definitions.definition: To make a noise like a duck.
definitions.example: Do you hear the ducks quack?

definitions.definition: A fraudulent healer or incompetent professional; especially, a doctor of medicine who makes false diagnoses or inappropriate treatment; an impostor who claims to have qualifications to practice medicine.
definitions.example: That doctor is nothing but a lousy quack!

definitions.definition: A charlatan.
A doctor.
To practice or commit quackery (fraudulent medicine).
To make vain and loud pretensions.
Falsely presented as having medicinal powers.
definitions.example: Don't get your hopes up; that's quack medicine!

definitions.definition: Existing or occurring between planets
definitions.example: Humans are just beginning to explore interplanetary travel.

definitions.definition: A heavy fighting club.
definitions.example: 1786, The Mace is an ancient weapon, formerly much used by cavalry of all nations, and likewise by ecclesiastics, who in consequence of their tenures, frequently took the field, but were by a canon of the church forbidden to wield the sword. — Francis Grose, A Treatise on Ancient Armour and Weapons, page 51.

definitions.definition: A ceremonial form of this weapon.
definitions.example: 1598, I am a king that find thee; and I know 'Tis not the balm, the sceptre, and the ball, The sword, the mace, the crown imperial, The intertissued robe of gold and pearl... — William Shakespeare, Henvry V, Act IV, Scene I, line 259.

definitions.definition: A long baton used by some drum majors to keep time and lead a marching band. If this baton is referred to as a mace, by convention it has a ceremonial often decorative head, which, if of metal, usually is hollow and sometimes intricately worked.
An officer who carries a mace as an emblem of authority.
A knobbed mallet used by curriers in dressing leather to make it supple.
A billiard cue.
To hit someone or something with a mace.
An old money of account in China equal to one tenth of a tael.
An old weight of 57.98 grains.
A spice obtained from the outer layer of the kernel of the fruit of the nutmeg.
Tear gas or pepper spray, especially for personal use.
To spray in defense or attack with mace (pepper spray or tear gas) using a hand-held device.
To spray a similar noxious chemical in defense or attack using an available hand-held device such as an aerosol spray can.
A tip of the hat.
An acknowledgment or expression of gratitude, especially for information or inspiration received.
A machine outfitted with sharp blades, for mashing, crushing or liquefying food ingredients.
A piece of fabric sewn into the front of a theatrical wig to make it blend in with the performer's natural hair.
(quilting) A subtly patterned fabric printed in different shades of a single color, often used in place of a solid to create visual texture.
A long, thin jaw.
A tree of the genus Mora
The wood of such trees
A piece of hard candy on a stick; a lollipop.
Money.
Any confection made from sugar, or high in sugar content; a sweet, a piece of candy.
A lump.
Snow or fine ice floating on water.
A thighbone.
The middle segment of the leg of an insect, between the trochanter and the tibia.
A segment of the leg of an arachnid.
An aviator who flies new and modified aircraft in specific maneuvers.
Part of a website where visitors can converse in typed messages.
A motion picture produced by an Italian-based company and filmed in Europe, notably in Italy, and depicting a tale of cowboys and desperadoes set in the American Old West.
definitions.example: “A Fistful of Dollars” and “Once Upon a Time in the West” are famous spaghetti westerns.

definitions.definition: An area in which land mines have been laid.
(by extension) A dangerous situation.
A pitch that has dried out and crumbled and on which the ball is bouncing and spinning unpredictably.
A guard, particularly on duty at the entrance to a military base.
Sentry duty; time spent being a sentry.
A form of drag to be towed underwater, which on striking bottom is upset and rises to the surface.
A watchtower.
A categorical proposition.
Absolute; having no exception.
Of, pertaining to, or using a category or categories.
A plastic or rubber mask through which oxygen may be breathed from a storage tank.
Dad, daddy, father; a familiar or old-fashioned term of address to one’s father.
A pet name for one's grandfather.
A parish priest in the Greek Orthodox Church.
The letter P in the ICAO spelling alphabet.
